New Records: Venezuela recorded their first victory against Ecuador at a Copa America since 2011.
Key Match Events: Kendry Paez played a key role in the pivotal moment of Ecuador’s 2-1 defeat to Venezuela.
Enner Valencia received a red card after a VAR check for a chest-high kick.
Jeremy Sarmiento opened the scoring for Ecuador with a well-taken finish on 39 minutes.
Venezuela's Jhonder Cádiz and Eduard Bello scored after half-time substitutions.
Post-Match Reflections: Kendry Paez showed his frustration as he narrowly missed the net after a shot on goal.
Paez was energetic and proactive despite Ecuador being a man down.
Venezuela's coach Fernando Batista made key substitutions that changed the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in hot conditions at Levi’s Stadium in San Jose, California.
Kendry Paez is considered one of the most exciting teenagers in world football.
Paez will join Chelsea in May 2025 after turning 18.
